intro: Draba tolmatchevii, commonly known as the Tolmachev's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky or alpine environments, often in well-drained soils. Draba tolmatchevii is typically found at elevations above 2,000 meters, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
